messages.page_content:
- Topic: Ordinance for Zoning Change in District A
- Summary: The ordinance proposed a zoning change in District A to allow for the construction of a new commercial building. After extensive discussion, the ordinance passed with a vote of 4 YEAS, 2 NAYS, and 1 ABSTAIN.
- Ordinance Number: 12345
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (4 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The zoning change was approved, allowing for the construction of the new commercial building.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning Change, District A, Commercial Building
- UID: 2f474d99-9be6-423b-877e-e162764838e6

- Topic: Mystic Krewe of Femme Fatale Crown Jewels Recognition
- Summary: The Mystic Krewe of Femme Fatale is officially proclaiming and honoring all Mardi Gras Queens, with specific individuals being recognized for their roles within the Krewe.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Recognition and honoring of Mardi Gras Queens
- Tags/Keywords: Mardi Gras, Mystic Krewe of Femme Fatale, Crown Jewels
- UID: df72d29b-fc9a-441d-bb72-abe69f6e784f

- Topic: Introduction of 2022 Zulu Social Aid & Pleasure Club Mardi Gras Court
- Summary: Presentation of the Zulu Social Aid & Pleasure Club, Inc. 2022 Mardi Gras Court in celebration of the 2022 Mardi Gras season.

- Topic: Communications related to electric and gas utility matters

- Topic: Change in polling location due to street name change

- Topic: Appeal for New Two-Story Porte-Cochere Side Addition and Chimney Removal
- Summary: Brian J. Gille, AIA, NCARB appealed the Historic District Landmarks Commission’s decision to deny a new two-story porte-cochere side addition and the removal of an existing masonry chimney for the property located at 5718 St. Charles Avenue. The hearing date is set for 3/10/22.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Appeal hearing scheduled for 3/10/22
- Tags/Keywords: Appeal, Historic District Landmarks Commission, Property, Hearing Date
- UID: 16004abe-0ca7-4b43-9179-9fa85268619c

- Topic: Appeal for Demolition to Grade of Single Family Home
- Summary: Susan P. Johnson requested to appeal the Historic District Landmarks Commission’s decision to approve the demolition to grade of the contributing-rated, one-story single family home for the property located at 1025 Henry Clay Avenue. The hearing date is set for 3/10/22.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Appeal hearing scheduled for 3/10/22
- Tags/Keywords: Appeal, Historic District Landmarks Commission, Demolition, Property, Hearing Date
- UID: 16004abe-0ca7-4b43-9179-9fa85268619c

- Topic: Amendment to Capital Budget
- Summary: Councilmember Moreno introduced an ordinance to amend and re-ordain the capital budget for the year 2021. The Budget/Audit/Board of Review Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was adopted.

- Topic: Amendment to Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: Councilmember Morrell proposed an ordinance to modify regulations for signage on medical campuses. The ordinance aimed to amend and reordain specific articles of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance. The ordinance was electronically submitted.

- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Submission for consideration

- Topic: Zoning Change and Conditional Use for Bar Expansion
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to change the zoning from HU-RD2 Historic Urban Two-Family Residential District to an HU-MU Historic Urban Neighborhood Mixed-Use District, and to allow the expansion of an existing bar up to 10,000 square feet in the floor area. 
- Ordinance Number: 33588 - 28937 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: ADOPTED - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning Change, Conditional Use, Bar Expansion
- UID: d2a79ea7-e9a1-4701-9f65-97f8a63e76f9

- Topic: Conditional Use for Accessory Off-Street Parking Lot
- Summary: The ordinance sought to grant a conditional use to permit an accessory off-street parking lot in an HUC Historic Urban Corridor Use Restriction Overlay District.

- Topic: Establishing a conditional use for a neighborhood commercial establishment in specific residential and parking districts
- Summary: The ordinance aims to permit a neighborhood commercial establishment in an HU-RD2 Historic Urban Two-Family Residential District and the Lower Ninth Ward Off-Street Parking Interim Zoning District. It is located on Square 982, Lot 11, in the Third Municipal District. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,602
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance to establish a conditional use for a neighborhood commercial establishment was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Commercial Establishment, Residential District, Parking District
- UID: 98015fff-c145-4958-8f19-186042a093f7

- Topic: Amending Article 24 of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to add Tujague’s signage to designated classic signs
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend and reordain Article 24 of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to add Tujague’s signage to designated classic signs and to establish permissions for a replica of any classic sign to be installed at a new location when a business moves. It affects classic signage procedures citywide and specifically designates classic and replica signs. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,603
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance to amend and reordain Article 24 of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning Ordinance, Classic Signs, Replica Signs, Citywide Signage
- UID: 98015fff-c145-4958-8f19-186042a093f7

- Topic: Amending and reordaining Article 10 of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend and reordain Article 10 of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance. The specific details of the amendments or reordinances are not provided in the summary. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,604
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance to amend and reordain Article 10 of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance was adopted.

- UID: 98015fff-c145-4958-8f19-186042a093f7

- Topic: Zoning Classification for "Wine Shop" in Historic District
- Summary: The ordinance aims to classify "wine shop" as a conditional use in the HMC-2 Historic Marigny/Tremé/Bywater Commercial District. It was adopted after being amended by Ordinance No. 26,413 M.C.S. and subsequent amendments.
- Ordinance Number: 4264 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: ADOPTED - (33604 - 28943 M.C.S.)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Wine Shop, Historic District
- UID: 304ac768-2763-4c70-8a71-c07c1a9a2992

- Topic: Conditional Use for Commercial Use in Historic Urban Mixed-Use District
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to establish a conditional use to permit a commercial use over 5,000 sq. ft. in an HU-MU Historic Urban Mixed-Use District. The matter was moved to be continued later in the meeting.
- Ordinance Number: 33605
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Cm. Harris moved to continue this matter to later in the meeting
- Decision/Key Actions: The matter was moved to be continued later in the meeting.
- Tags/Keywords: Conditional Use, Commercial Use, Urban Mixed-Use District
- UID: 304ac768-2763-4c70-8a71-c07c1a9a2992

- Topic: Establishment of City Council SWBNO Substation Support Fund

- Topic: Appropriation of ARPA funds for SWBNO substation development
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to appropriate American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) funds for the building and development of a new substation to provide power from Entergy for SWBNO use. The Budget/Audit/Board of Review Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33618
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: ARPA funds, SWBNO, substation development
- UID: 6b81ec29-2121-4eee-b307-abcbbbbe30dd

- Topic: Appropriation of ARPA funds for CEA between City of New Orleans and SWBNO
- Summary: This ordinance aims to appropriate American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) funds for the funding of a CEA between the City of New Orleans and Sewerage and Waterboard of New Orleans (SWBNO) for the building and development of a new substation. The Budget/Audit/Board of Review Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33619
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)

- Summary: The amendment to the Classified Pay Plan was approved, including changes to the hiring rates for various positions and the introduction of a new special rate of pay for employees assigned inspectional duties relating to the construction of public infrastructure and facilities.

- Topic: HDLC Appeal of Alexander Adamick, M. Arch, AIA, NCARB, Principal Architect, Adamick Architecture
- Summary: The appeal was for the Historic District Landmarks Commission's decision to deny the demolition of the property located at 5427 Dauphine Street. The council overruled the decision and granted the applicant's request for the property.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-78
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Support for redistricting outcomes in Louisiana
- Summary: Resolution R-22-113 expresses Council support for redistricting outcomes that maintain the same number of majority minority Louisiana Senate seats in New Orleans and support the expansion of district seats in the Louisiana House of Representatives for New Orleans to reflect population growth, while maintaining currently allotted majority minority seats.
